title: 114_hr2391
content: The Act titled "Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015" applies the Medicaid additional rebate requirement to generic drugs. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 applies an additional rebate requirement to generic drugs under Section 1927(c)(3) of the Social Security Act. The rebate amount for certain covered outpatient drugs is increased, excluding single source or innovator multiple source drugs. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 increases rebates for certain covered outpatient drugs, excluding single source or innovator multiple source drugs. Special rules apply for the application of this provision. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 increases rebates for certain covered outpatient drugs, with special rules for application. The reference to specific calendar quarters and dates is adjusted for drug pricing calculations. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 adjusts references to calendar quarters and dates for drug pricing calculations, with special rules for certain drugs. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 adjusts drug pricing calculations, with special rules for certain noninnovator multiple source drugs. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 adjusts drug pricing calculations, with special rules for certain noninnovator multiple source drugs. The amendments made by subsection (a) apply to rebate periods beginning after December 31, 2014. The term 'applicable quarter' is defined as the fifth full calendar quarter in which the drug is sold as a drug other than a single source drug or an innovator multiple source drug.
